If this in turn is an Internet MTA this should be the domain name. For an OSI MTA it should be the string encoded distinguished name of the managed object using the format defined in RFC 2253. For X.400(1984) MTAs which do not have a Distinguished Name, the RFC 2156 syntax \'mta in globalid\' used in X400-Received: fields can be used.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupSuccessfulConvertedMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of messages that have been successfully converted from one form to another in this group since group creation.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupFailedConvertedMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of messages for which an unsuccessful attempt was made to convert them from one form to another in this group since group creation.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupDescription[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A description of the group\'s purpose. This information is intended to identify the group in a status display.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupURL[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A URL pointing to a description of the group. This information is intended to identify and briefly describe the group in a status display.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupCreationTime[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, mtaGroupHierarchy, long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.28.2.1.31, MTA-MIB, mtaGroupEntry, 31, 0,

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupOldestMessageId[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Message ID of the oldest message in the group\'s queue. Whenever possible this should be in the form of an RFC 822 msg-id; X.400 may convert X.400 message identifiers to this form by following the rules laid out in RFC2156.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupLoopsDetected[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A message loop is defined as a situation where the MTA decides that a given message will never be delivered to one or more recipients and instead will continue to loop endlessly through one or more MTAs. This variable counts the number of times the MTA has detected such a situation in conjunction with something associated with this group since group creation. Note that the mechanism MTAs use to detect loops (e.g., trace field counting, count of references to this MTA in a trace field, examination of DNS or other directory information, etc.), the level at which loops are detected (e.g., per message, per recipient, per directory entry, etc.), and the handling of a loop once it is detected (e.g., looping messages are held, looping messages are bounced or sent to the postmaster, messages that the MTA knows will loop won\'t be accepted, etc.) vary widely from one MTA to the next and cannot be inferred from this variable.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupLastOutboundAssociationAttempt[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Time since the last time that this group attempted to make an outbound association for purposes of message delivery.

discovery_rule.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdTable
discovery_rule.description: A table of management event trigger information for threshold triggers.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdStartup[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The event that may be triggered when this entry is first set to \'active\' and a new instance of the object at mteTriggerValueID is found. If the first sample after this instance becomes active is greater than or equal to mteTriggerThresholdRising and mteTriggerThresholdStartup is equal to \'rising\' or \'risingOrFalling\', then one mteTriggerThresholdRisingEvent is triggered for that instance. If the first sample after this entry becomes active is less than or equal to mteTriggerThresholdFalling and mteTriggerThresholdStartup is equal to \'falling\' or \'risingOrFalling\', then one mteTriggerThresholdRisingEvent is triggered for that instance.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdFalling[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A threshold value to check against if mteTriggerType is \'threshold\'. When the current sampled value is less than or equal to this threshold, and the value at the last sampling interval was greater than this threshold, one mteTriggerThresholdFallingEvent is triggered. That event is also triggered if the first sample after this entry becomes active is less than or equal to this threshold and mteTriggerThresholdStartup is equal to \'falling\' or \'risingOrFalling\'. After a falling event is generated, another such event is not triggered until the sampled value rises above this threshold and reaches mteTriggerThresholdRising.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRising[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A threshold value to check against if mteTriggerType is \'threshold\'. When the delta value (difference) between the current sampled value (value(n)) and the previous sampled value (value(n-1)) is greater than or equal to this threshold, and the delta value calculated at the last sampling interval (i.e. value(n-1) - value(n-2)) was less than this threshold, one mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRisingEvent is triggered. That event is also triggered if the first delta value calculated after this entry becomes active, i.e. value(2) - value(1), where value(1) is the first sample taken of that instance, is greater than or equal to this threshold. After a rising event is generated, another such event is not triggered until the delta value falls below this threshold and reaches mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFalling.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFalling[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A threshold value to check against if mteTriggerType is \'threshold\'. When the delta value (difference) between the current sampled value (value(n)) and the previous sampled value (value(n-1)) is less than or equal to this threshold, and the delta value calculated at the last sampling interval (i.e. value(n-1) - value(n-2)) was greater than this threshold, one mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFallingEvent is triggered. That event is also triggered if the first delta value calculated after this entry becomes active, i.e. value(2) - value(1), where value(1) is the first sample taken of that instance, is less than or equal to this threshold. After a falling event is generated, another such event is not triggered until the delta value falls below this threshold and reaches mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRising.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdObjectsOwner[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: To go with mteTriggerThresholdObjects, the mteOwner of a group of objects from mteObjectsTable.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdObjects[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The mteObjectsName of a group of objects from mteObjectsTable. These objects are to be added to any Notification resulting from the firing of this trigger for this test. A list of objects may also be added based on the overall trigger, the event or other settings in mteTriggerTest. A length of 0 indicates no additional objects.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdRisingEventOwner[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: To go with mteTriggerThresholdRisingEvent, the mteOwner of an event entry from mteEventTable.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdRisingEvent[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The mteEventName of the event to invoke when mteTriggerType is \'threshold\' and this trigger fires based on mteTriggerThresholdRising. A length of 0 indicates no event.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdFallingEventOwner[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: To go with mteTriggerThresholdFallingEvent, the mteOwner of an event entry from mteEventTable.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdFallingEvent[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The mteEventName of the event to invoke when mteTriggerType is \'threshold\' and this trigger fires based on mteTriggerThresholdFalling. A length of 0 indicates no event.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRisingEventOwner[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: To go with mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRisingEvent, the mteOwner of an event entry from mteEventTable.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRisingEvent[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The mteEventName of the event to invoke when mteTriggerType is \'threshold\' and this trigger fires based on mteTriggerThresholdDeltaRising. A length of 0 indicates no event.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFallingEventOwner[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: To go with mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFallingEvent, the mteOwner of an event entry from mteEventTable.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFallingEvent[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The mteEventName of the event to invoke when mteTriggerType is \'threshold\' and this trigger fires based on mteTriggerThresholdDeltaFalling. A length of 0 indicates no event.

discovery_rule.name: MTA-MIB::mtaTable
discovery_rule.description: * index, applIndex, long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.27.1.1.1, NETWORK-SERVICES-MIB, applEntry, 1, 0,

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaReceivedMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of messages received since MTA initialization. This includes messages transmitted to this MTA from other MTAs as well as messages that have been submitted to the MTA directly by end-users or applications.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaStoredMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of messages currently stored in the MTA. This includes messages that are awaiting transmission to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaTransmittedMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of messages transmitted since MTA initialization. This includes messages that were transmitted to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaReceivedVolume[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages received since MTA initialization, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all transferred data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data. This includes messages transmitted to this MTA from other MTAs as well as messages that have been submitted to the MTA directly by end-users or applications.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaStoredVolume[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages currently stored in the MTA, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all stored data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA would use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data. This includes messages that are awaiting transmission to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaTransmittedVolume[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total volume of messages transmitted since MTA initialization, measured in kilo-octets. This volume should include all transferred data that is logically above the mail transport protocol level. For example, an SMTP-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets in the message header and body, while an X.400-based MTA should use the number of kilo-octets of P2 data. This includes messages that were transmitted to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaReceivedRecipients[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages received since MTA initialization. Recipients this MTA has no responsibility for, i.e. inactive envelope recipients or ones referred to in message headers, should not be counted even if information about such recipients is available. This includes messages transmitted to this MTA from other MTAs as well as messages that have been submitted to the MTA directly by end-users or applications.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaStoredRecipients[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages currently stored in the MTA. Recipients this MTA has no responsibility for, i.e. inactive envelope recipients or ones referred to in message headers, should not be counted. This includes messages that are awaiting transmission to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaTransmittedRecipients[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of recipients specified in all messages transmitted since MTA initialization. Recipients this MTA had no responsibility for, i.e. inactive envelope recipients or ones referred to in message headers, should not be counted. This includes messages that were transmitted to some other MTA or are waiting for delivery to an end-user or application.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaSuccessfulConvertedMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of messages that have been successfully converted from one form to another since MTA initialization.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaFailedConvertedMessages[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of messages for which an unsuccessful attempt was made to convert them from one form to another since MTA initialization.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaLoopsDetected[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A message loop is defined as a situation where the MTA decides that a given message will never be delivered to one or more recipients and instead will continue to loop endlessly through one or more MTAs. This variable counts the number of times the MTA has detected such a situation since MTA initialization. Note that the mechanism MTAs use to detect loops (e.g., trace field counting, count of references to this MTA in a trace field, examination of DNS or other directory information, etc.), the level at which loops are detected (e.g., per message, per recipient, per directory entry, etc.), and the handling of a loop once it is detected (e.g., looping messages are held, looping messages are bounced or sent to the postmaster, messages that the MTA knows will loop won\'t be accepted, etc.) vary widely from one MTA to the next and cannot be inferred from this variable.

discovery_rule.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndexTable
discovery_rule.description: The table used to describe IPv6 unicast and multicast scope zones. For those objects that have names rather than numbers, the names were chosen to coincide with the names used in the IPv6 address architecture document.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndexLinkLocal[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, ipv6ScopeZoneIndex3, u_long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.36.1.3, IP-MIB, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexEntry, 3, 0,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndexAdminLocal[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexSiteLocal, u_long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.36.1.5, IP-MIB, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexEntry, 5, 0,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndex6[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, ipv6ScopeZoneIndex7, u_long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.36.1.7, IP-MIB, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexEntry, 7, 0,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndexOrganizationLocal[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The zone index for the organization-local scope on this interface.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndex9[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexA, u_long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.36.1.10, IP-MIB, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexEntry, 10, 0,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndexB[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexC, u_long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.36.1.12, IP-MIB, ipv6ScopeZoneIndexEntry, 12, 0,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6ScopeZoneIndexD[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * table, ipDefaultRouterTable, , .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.37, IP-MIB, ip, 37, 0,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipDefaultRouterLifetime[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The remaining length of time, in seconds, that this router will continue to be useful as a default router. A value of zero indicates that it is no longer useful as a default router. It is left to the implementer of the MIB as to whether a router with a lifetime of zero is removed from the list. For IPv6, this value should be extracted from the router advertisement messages.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipDefaultRouterPreference[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An indication of preference given to this router as a default router as described in he Default Router Preferences document. Treating the value as a 2 bit signed integer allows for simple arithmetic comparisons. For IPv4 routers or IPv6 routers that are not using the updated router advertisement format, this object is set to medium (0).

discovery_rule.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterProfileTable
discovery_rule.description: This table is used to associate a notification filter profile with a particular set of target parameters.

item_prototype.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterProfileName[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The name of the filter profile to be used when generating notifications using the corresponding entry in the snmpTargetAddrTable.

item_prototype.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterProfileStorType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The storage type for this conceptual row. Conceptual rows having the value \'permanent\' need not allow write-access to any columnar objects in the row.

discovery_rule.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetTable
discovery_rule.description: * index, mteOwner, char, .1.3.6.1.2.1.88.1.2.2.1.1, DISMAN-EVENT-MIB, mteTriggerEntry, 1, 0,

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetObject[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The object identifier from the MIB object to set if mteEventActions has \'set\' set. This object identifier may be wildcarded by leaving sub-identifiers off the end, in which case nteEventSetObjectWildCard must be \'true\'. If mteEventSetObject is wildcarded the instance used to set the object to which it points is the same as the instance from the value of mteTriggerValueID that triggered the event. Each instance that fills the wildcard is independent of any additional instances, that is, wildcarded objects operate as if there were a separate table entry for each instance that fills the wildcard without having to actually predict all possible instances ahead of time. Bad object identifiers or a mismatch between truncating the identifier and the value of mteSetObjectWildcard result in operation as one would expect when providing the wrong identifier to a Set operation. The Set will fail or set the wrong object. If the value syntax of the destination object is not correct, the Set fails with the normal SNMP error code.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetObjectWildcard[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Control over whether mteEventSetObject is to be treated as fully-specified or wildcarded, with \'true\' indicating wildcard if mteEventActions has \'set\' set.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetValue[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value to which to set the object at mteEventSetObject if mteEventActions has \'set\' set.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetTargetTag[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The tag for the target(s) at which to set the object at mteEventSetObject to mteEventSetValue if mteEventActions has \'set\' set. Systems limited to self management MAY reject a non-zero length for the value of this object. A length of 0 indicates the local system. In this case, access to the objects indicated by mteEventSetObject is under the security credentials of the requester that set mteTriggerEntryStatus to \'active\'. Those credentials are the input parameters for isAccessAllowed from the Architecture for Describing SNMP Management Frameworks. Otherwise access rights are checked according to the security parameters resulting from the tag.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetContextName[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The management context in which to set mteEventObjectID. if mteEventActions has \'set\' set. This may be wildcarded by leaving characters off the end. To indicate such wildcarding mteEventSetContextNameWildcard must be \'true\'. If this context name is wildcarded the value used to complete the wildcarding of mteTriggerContextName will be appended.

item_prototype.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteEventSetContextNameWildcard[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Control for whether mteEventSetContextName is to be treated as fully-specified or wildcarded, with \'true\' indicating wildcard if mteEventActions has \'set\' set.

discovery_rule.name: IF-MIB::ifTable
discovery_rule.description: A list of interface entries. The number of entries is given by the value of ifNumber.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifMtu[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The size of the largest packet which can be sent/received on the interface, specified in octets. For interfaces that are used for transmitting network datagrams, this is the size of the largest network datagram that can be sent on the interface.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifSpeed[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An estimate of the interface\'s current bandwidth in bits per second. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. If the bandwidth of the interface is greater than the maximum value reportable by this object then this object should report its maximum value (4,294,967,295) and ifHighSpeed must be used to report the interace\'s speed. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifPhysAddress[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The interface\'s address at its protocol sub-layer. For example, for an 802.x interface, this object normally contains a MAC address. The interface\'s media-specific MIB must define the bit and byte ordering and the format of the value of this object. For interfaces which do not have such an address (e.g., a serial line), this object should contain an octet string of zero length.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifAdminStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface. The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. When a managed system initializes, all interfaces start with ifAdminStatus in the down(2) state. As a result of either explicit management action or per configuration information retained by the managed system, ifAdminStatus is then changed to either the up(1) or testing(3) states (or remains in the down(2) state).

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifInOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifInUcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifInNUcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime. This object is deprecated in favour of ifInMulticastPkts and ifInBroadcastPkts.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifInDiscards[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifInErrors[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character- oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifInUnknownProtos[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces that support protocol multiplexing the number of transmission units received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. For any interface that does not support protocol multiplexing, this counter will always be 0. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifOutOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifOutUcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifOutNUcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sub-layer, including those that were discarded or not sent. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime. This object is deprecated in favour of ifOutMulticastPkts and ifOutBroadcastPkts.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifOutDiscards[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifOutErrors[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IF-MIB::ifOutQLen[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, ifSpecific, oid, .1.3.6.1.2.1.2.2.1.22, IF-MIB, ifEntry, 22, 0,

item_prototype.name: NOTIFICATION-LOG-MIB::nlmLogVariableIpAddressVal[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value when nlmLogVariableType is \'ipAddress\'. Although this seems to be unfriendly for IPv6, we have to recognize that there are a number of older MIBs that do contain an IPv4 format address, known as IpAddress. IPv6 addresses are represented using TAddress or InetAddress, and so the underlying datatype is OCTET STRING, and their value would be stored in the nlmLogVariableOctetStringVal column.

item_prototype.name: NOTIFICATION-LOG-MIB::nlmLogVariableOidVal[{#SNMPINDEX}]

item_prototype.name: NOTIFICATION-LOG-MIB::nlmLogVariableOpaqueVal[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * table, prTable, , .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.2, UCD-SNMP-MIB, ucdavis, 2, 0,

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::prMin[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The minimum number of processes that should be \t running. An error flag is generated if the number of \t running processes is < the minimum.

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::prMax[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The maximum number of processes that should be \t running. An error flag is generated if the number of \t running processes is > the maximum.

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::prCount[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of current processes running with the name \t in question.

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::prErrorFlag[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A Error flag to indicate trouble with a process. It \t goes to 1 if there is an error, 0 if no error.

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::prErrMessage[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, prErrFix, long, .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.2.1.102, UCD-SNMP-MIB, prEntry, 102, 1,

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::prErrFixCmd[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The command that gets run when the prErrFix column is \t set to 1.

discovery_rule.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertTable
discovery_rule.description: The table containing information used to construct router advertisements.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertSendAdverts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A flag indicating whether the router sends periodic router advertisements and responds to router solicitations on this interface.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertMaxInterval[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The maximum time allowed between sending unsolicited router advertisements from this interface.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertMinInterval[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The minimum time allowed between sending unsolicited router advertisements from this interface. The default is 0.33 * ipv6RouterAdvertMaxInterval, however, in the case of a low value for ipv6RouterAdvertMaxInterval, the minimum value for this object is restricted to 3.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertManagedFlag[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The true/false value to be placed into the \'managed address configuration\' flag field in router advertisements sent from this interface.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertOtherConfigFlag[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The true/false value to be placed into the \'other stateful configuration\' flag field in router advertisements sent from this interface.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertLinkMTU[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value to be placed in MTU options sent by the router on this interface. A value of zero indicates that no MTU options are sent.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertReachableTime[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value to be placed in the reachable time field in router advertisement messages sent from this interface. A value of zero in the router advertisement indicates that the advertisement isn\'t specifying a value for reachable time.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertRetransmitTime[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value to be placed in the retransmit timer field in router advertisements sent from this interface. A value of zero in the router advertisement indicates that the advertisement isn\'t specifying a value for retrans time.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertCurHopLimit[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The default value to be placed in the current hop limit field in router advertisements sent from this interface. The value should be set to the current diameter of the Internet. A value of zero in the router advertisement indicates that the advertisement isn\'t specifying a value for curHopLimit. The default should be set to the value specified in the IANA web pages (www.iana.org) at the time of implementation.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertDefaultLifetime[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value to be placed in the router lifetime field of router advertisements sent from this interface. This value MUST be either 0 or between ipv6RouterAdvertMaxInterval and 9000 seconds. A value of zero indicates that the router is not to be used as a default router. The default is 3 * ipv6RouterAdvertMaxInterval.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipv6RouterAdvertRowStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The status of this conceptual row. As all objects in this conceptual row have default values, a row can be created and made active by setting this object appropriately. The RowStatus TC requires that this DESCRIPTION clause states under which circumstances other objects in this row can be modified. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified.

discovery_rule.name: SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB::vacmContextTable
discovery_rule.description: The table of locally available contexts. This table provides information to SNMP Command Generator applications so that they can properly configure the vacmAccessTable to control access to all contexts at the SNMP entity. This table may change dynamically if the SNMP entity allows that contexts are added/deleted dynamically (for instance when its configuration changes). Such changes would happen only if the management instrumentation at that SNMP entity recognizes more (or fewer) contexts. The presence of entries in this table and of entries in the vacmAccessTable are independent. That is, a context identified by an entry in this table is not necessarily referenced by any entries in the vacmAccessTable; and the context(s) referenced by an entry in the vacmAccessTable does not necessarily currently exist and thus need not be identified by an entry in this table. This table must be made accessible via the default context so that Command Responder applications have a standard way of retrieving the information. This table is read-only. It cannot be configured via SNMP.

discovery_rule.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrNetworkTable
discovery_rule.description: The (conceptual) table of network devices contained by the host. Note that this table is potentially sparse: a (conceptual) entry exists only if the correspondent value of the hrDeviceType object is `hrDeviceNetwork\'.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrNetworkIfIndex[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value of ifIndex which corresponds to this network device. If this device is not represented in the ifTable, then this value shall be zero.

discovery_rule.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterTable
discovery_rule.description: The table of filter profiles. Filter profiles are used to determine whether particular management targets should receive particular notifications. When a notification is generated, it must be compared with the filters associated with each management target which is configured to receive notifications, in order to determine whether it may be sent to each such management target. A more complete discussion of notification filtering can be found in section 6. of [SNMP-APPL].

item_prototype.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterMask[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The bit mask which, in combination with the corresponding instance of snmpNotifyFilterSubtree, defines a family of subtrees which are included in or excluded from the filter profile. Each bit of this bit mask corresponds to a sub-identifier of snmpNotifyFilterSubtree, with the most significant bit of the i-th octet of this octet string value (extended if necessary, see below) corresponding to the (8*i - 7)-th sub-identifier, and the least significant bit of the i-th octet of this octet string corresponding to the (8*i)-th sub-identifier, where i is in the range 1 through 16. Each bit of this bit mask specifies whether or not the corresponding sub-identifiers must match when determining if an OBJECT IDENTIFIER matches this family of filter subtrees; a \'1\' indicates that an exact match must occur; a \'0\' indicates \'wild card\', i.e., any sub-identifier value matches. Thus, the OBJECT IDENTIFIER X of an object instance is contained in a family of filter subtrees if, for each sub-identifier of the value of snmpNotifyFilterSubtree, either: the i-th bit of snmpNotifyFilterMask is 0, or the i-th sub-identifier of X is equal to the i-th sub-identifier of the value of snmpNotifyFilterSubtree. If the value of this bit mask is M bits long and there are more than M sub-identifiers in the corresponding instance of snmpNotifyFilterSubtree, then the bit mask is extended with 1\'s to be the required length. Note that when the value of this object is the zero-length string, this extension rule results in a mask of all-1\'s being used (i.e., no \'wild card\'), and the family of filter subtrees is the one subtree uniquely identified by the corresponding instance of snmpNotifyFilterSubtree.

item_prototype.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: This object indicates whether the family of filter subtrees defined by this entry are included in or excluded from a filter. A more detailed discussion of the use of this object can be found in section 6. of [SNMP-APPL].

item_prototype.name: SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB::snmpNotifyFilterStorageType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The storage type for this conceptual row. Conceptual rows having the value \'permanent\' need not allow write-access to any columnar objects in the row.

discovery_rule.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSTable
discovery_rule.description: The (conceptual) table of file systems local to this host or remotely mounted from a file server. File systems that are in only one user\'s environment on a multi-user system will not be included in this table.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSMountPoint[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, hrFSRemoteMountPoint, char, .1.3.6.1.2.1.25.3.8.1.3, HOST-RESOURCES-MIB, hrFSEntry, 3, 0,

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value of this object identifies the type of this file system.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSAccess[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An indication if this file system is logically configured by the operating system to be readable and writable or only readable. This does not represent any local access-control policy, except one that is applied to the file system as a whole.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSBootable[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: A flag indicating whether this file system is bootable.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSStorageIndex[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The index of the hrStorageEntry that represents information about this file system. If there is no such information available, then this value shall be zero. The relevant storage entry will be useful in tracking the percent usage of this file system and diagnosing errors that may occur when it runs out of space.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSLastFullBackupDate[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The last date at which this complete file system was copied to another storage device for backup. This information is useful for ensuring that backups are being performed regularly. If this information is not known, then this variable shall have the value corresponding to January 1, year 0000, 00:00:00.0, which is encoded as (hex)\'00 00 01 01 00 00 00 00\'.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrFSLastPartialBackupDate[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The last date at which a portion of this file system was copied to another storage device for backup. This information is useful for ensuring that backups are being performed regularly. If this information is not known, then this variable shall have the value corresponding to January 1, year 0000, 00:00:00.0, which is encoded as (hex)\'00 00 01 01 00 00 00 00\'.

discovery_rule.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunPerfTable
discovery_rule.description: The (conceptual) table of running software performance metrics.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunPerfCPU[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of centi-seconds of the total system\'s CPU resources consumed by this process. Note that on a multi-processor system, this value may increment by more than one centi-second in one centi-second of real (wall clock) time.

item_prototype.name: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrSWRunPerfMem[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total amount of real system memory allocated to this process.

discovery_rule.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsTable
discovery_rule.description: The table containing system wide, IP version specific traffic statistics. This table and the ipIfStatsTable contain similar objects whose difference is in their granularity. Where this table contains system wide traffic statistics, the ipIfStatsTable contains the same statistics but counted on a per-interface basis.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInReceives[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of input IP datagrams received, including those received in error. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInReceives[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of input IP datagrams received, including those received in error. This object counts the same datagrams as ipSystemStatsInReceives, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received in input IP datagrams, including those received in error. Octets from datagrams counted in ipSystemStatsInReceives MUST be counted here. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received in input IP datagrams, including those received in error. This object counts the same octets as ipSystemStatsInOctets, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInHdrErrors[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input IP datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInNoRoutes[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInAddrErrors[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header\'s destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (e.g., ::0). For entities that are not IP routers and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInUnknownProtos[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of locally-addressed IP datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these datagrams were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the datagrams. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInTruncatedPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input IP datagrams discarded because the datagram frame didn\'t carry enough data. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInForwDatagrams[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which this entity attempted to find a route to forward them to that final destination. In entities that do not act as IP routers, this counter will include only those datagrams that were Source-Routed via this entity, and the Source-Route processing was successful. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the incoming interface is incremented for each datagram. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInForwDatagrams[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which this entity attempted to find a route to forward them to that final destination. This object counts the same packets as ipSystemStatsInForwDatagrams, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsReasmReqds[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this interface. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these fragments were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the fragments. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsReasmOKs[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP datagrams successfully reassembled. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these datagrams were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the datagrams. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsReasmFails[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc.). Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded IP fragments since some algorithms (notably the algorithm in RFC 815) can lose track of the number of fragments by combining them as they are received. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these fragments were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the fragments. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInDiscards[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting re-assembly. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInDelivers[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP). When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these datagrams were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the datagrams. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInDelivers[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP). This object counts the same packets as ipSystemStatsInDelivers, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutRequests[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of IP datagrams that local IP user- protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipSystemStatsOutForwDatagrams. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutRequests[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of IP datagrams that local IP user- protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. This object counts the same packets as ipSystemStatsOutRequests, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutNoRoutes[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of locally generated IP datagrams discarded because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutForwDatagrams[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which it was successful in finding a path to their final destination. In entities that do not act as IP routers, this counter will include only those datagrams that were Source-Routed via this entity, and the Source-Route processing was successful. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully forwarded datagram. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutForwDatagrams[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of datagrams for which this entity was not their final IP destination and for which it was successful in finding a path to their final destination. This object counts the same packets as ipSystemStatsOutForwDatagrams, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutDiscards[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of output IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space). Note that this counter would include datagrams counted in ipSystemStatsOutForwDatagrams if any such datagrams met this (discretionary) discard criterion. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutFragReqds[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP datagrams that would require fragmentation in order to be transmitted. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully fragmented datagram. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutFragOKs[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully fragmented datagram. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutFragFails[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented but could not be. This includes IPv4 packets that have the DF bit set and IPv6 packets that are being forwarded and exceed the outgoing link MTU. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for an unsuccessfully fragmented datagram. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutFragCreates[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of IP fragmentation. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully fragmented datagram. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutTransmits[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of IP datagrams that this entity supplied to the lower layers for transmission. This includes datagrams generated locally and those forwarded by this entity. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutTransmits[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of IP datagrams that this entity supplied to the lower layers for transmission. This object counts the same datagrams as ipSystemStatsOutTransmits, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets in IP datagrams delivered to the lower layers for transmission. Octets from datagrams counted in ipSystemStatsOutTransmits MUST be counted here. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets in IP datagrams delivered to the lower layers for transmission. This objects counts the same octets as ipSystemStatsOutOctets, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInMcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP multicast datagrams received. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInMcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP multicast datagrams received. This object counts the same datagrams as ipSystemStatsInMcastPkts but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInMcastOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received in IP multicast datagrams. Octets from datagrams counted in ipSystemStatsInMcastPkts MUST be counted here. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInMcastOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets received in IP multicast datagrams. This object counts the same octets as ipSystemStatsInMcastOctets, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutMcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP multicast datagrams transmitted. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutMcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP multicast datagrams transmitted. This object counts the same datagrams as ipSystemStatsOutMcastPkts, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutMcastOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted in IP multicast datagrams. Octets from datagrams counted in ipSystemStatsOutMcastPkts MUST be counted here. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutMcastOctets[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The total number of octets transmitted in IP multicast datagrams. This object counts the same octets as ipSystemStatsOutMcastOctets, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsInBcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP broadcast datagrams received. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCInBcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP broadcast datagrams received. This object counts the same datagrams as ipSystemStatsInBcastPkts but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsOutBcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP broadcast datagrams transmitted. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsHCOutBcastPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of IP broadcast datagrams transmitted. This object counts the same datagrams as ipSystemStatsOutBcastPkts, but allows for larger values. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsDiscontinuityTime[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value of sysUpTime on the most recent occasion at which any one or more of this entry\'s counters suffered a discontinuity. If no such discontinuities have occurred since the last re- initialization of the local management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipSystemStatsRefreshRate[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The minimum reasonable polling interval for this entry. This object provides an indication of the minimum amount of time required to update the counters in this entry.

discovery_rule.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLoggingTable
discovery_rule.description: A table of individual logging output destinations, used to control where various levels of output from the agent should be directed.

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * enum, stdout, 1,

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogMaxLevel[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The maximum priority level for which this logging entry should be applied.

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsLogStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Whether to generate logging output for this entry. Note that is valid for an instance to be left with the value notInService(2) indefinitely - i.e. the meaning of \'abnormally long\' (see RFC 2579, RowStatus) for this table is infinite.

discovery_rule.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsModuleTable
discovery_rule.description: A table displaying all the oid\'s registered by mib modules in \t the agent. Since the agent is modular in nature, this lists \t each module\'s OID it is responsible for and the name of the module

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsModuleModes[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The modes that the particular lower level handler can cope \t with directly.

discovery_rule.name: NET-SNMP-PASS-MIB::netSnmpPassTable
discovery_rule.description: * index, netSnmpPassIndex, long, .1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.255.2.1.1, NET-SNMP-PASS-MIB, netSnmpPassEntry, 1, 0,

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-PASS-MIB::netSnmpPassInteger[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, netSnmpPassOID, oid, .1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.255.2.1.3, NET-SNMP-PASS-MIB, netSnmpPassEntry, 3, 0,

discovery_rule.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupErrorTable
discovery_rule.description: The table holding information regarding accumulated errors for each MTA group.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupInboundErrorCount[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of errors of a given type that have been accumulated in association with a particular group while processing incoming messages. In the case of SMTP these will typically be errors reporting by an SMTP server to the remote client; in the case of X.400 these will typically be errors encountered while processing an incoming message.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupInternalErrorCount[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of errors of a given type that have been accumulated in association with a particular group during internal MTA processing.

item_prototype.name: MTA-MIB::mtaGroupOutboundErrorCount[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Count of the number of errors of a given type that have been accumulated in association with a particular group\'s outbound connection activities. In the case of an SMTP client these will typically be errors reported while attempting to contact or while communicating with the remote SMTP server. In the case of X.400 these will typically be errors encountered while constructing or attempting to deliver an outgoing message.

discovery_rule.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteTable
discovery_rule.description: * index, inetCidrRouteDestType, long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.4.24.7.1.1, IP-FORWARD-MIB, inetCidrRouteEntry, 1, 1,

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteIfIndex[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The ifIndex value that identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached. A value of 0 is valid and represents the scenario where no interface is specified.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The type of route. Note that local(3) refers to a route for which the next hop is the final destination; remote(4) refers to a route for which the next hop is not the final destination. Routes that do not result in traffic forwarding or rejection should not be displayed, even if the implementation keeps them stored internally. reject(2) refers to a route that, if matched, discards the message as unreachable and returns a notification (e.g., ICMP error) to the message sender. This is used in some protocols as a means of correctly aggregating routes. blackhole(5) refers to a route that, if matched, discards the message silently.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteNextHopAS[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The Autonomous System Number of the Next Hop. The semantics of this object are determined by the routing- protocol specified in the route\'s inetCidrRouteProto value. When this object is unknown or not relevant, its value should be set to zero.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteMetric1[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The primary routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing- protocol specified in the route\'s inetCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteMetric2[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing- protocol specified in the route\'s inetCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteMetric3[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing- protocol specified in the route\'s inetCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteMetric4[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing- protocol specified in the route\'s inetCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteMetric5[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing- protocol specified in the route\'s inetCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

item_prototype.name: IP-FORWARD-MIB::inetCidrRouteStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The row status variable, used according to row installation and removal conventions. A row entry cannot be modified when the status is marked as active(1).

discovery_rule.name: IP-MIB::icmpMsgStatsTable
discovery_rule.description: The table of system-wide per-version, per-message type ICMP counters.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::icmpMsgStatsInPkts[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, icmpMsgStatsOutPkts, u_long, .1.3.6.1.2.1.5.30.1.4, IP-MIB, icmpMsgStatsEntry, 4, 0,

discovery_rule.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsTransactionTable
discovery_rule.description: Lists currently outstanding transactions in the net-snmp agent. \t This includes requests to AgentX subagents, or proxied SNMP agents.

discovery_rule.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::extTable
discovery_rule.description: A table of extensible commands returning output and \t result codes. These commands are configured via the \t agent\'s snmpd.conf file.

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::extNames[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, extCommand, char, .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.8.1.3, UCD-SNMP-MIB, extEntry, 3, 0,

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::extResult[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, extOutput, char, .1.3.6.1.4.1.2021.8.1.101, UCD-SNMP-MIB, extEntry, 101, 0,

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::extErrFix[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Setting this to one will try to fix the problem if \t the agent has been configured with a script to call \t to attempt to fix problems automatically using remote \t snmp operations.

item_prototype.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB::extErrFixCmd[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The command that gets run when the extErrFix column is \t set to 1.

discovery_rule.name: NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB::nsExtendOutput1Table
discovery_rule.description: * index, nsExtendToken, char, .1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.1.3.2.2.1.1, NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB, nsExtendConfigEntry, 1, 0,

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB::nsExtendOutput1Line[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * nonindex, nsExtendOutputFull, char, .1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.1.3.2.3.1.2, NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB, nsExtendOutput1Entry, 2, 0,

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB::nsExtendOutNumLines[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The number of lines of output (and hence the number of rows in nsExtendOutputTable relating to this particular entry).

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB::nsExtendResult[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * table, nsExtendOutput2Table, , .1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.1.3.2.4, NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB, nsExtendObjects, 4, 0,

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-EXTEND-MIB::nsExtendOutLine[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * table, nsCacheTable, , .1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.1.5.3, NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB, nsCache, 3, 0,

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsCacheStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The current status of this particular cache entry. Acceptable values for Set requests are \'enabled(1)\', \'disabled(2)\' or \'empty(3)\' (to clear all cached data). Requests to read the value of such an object will return \'disabled(2)\' through to \'expired(5)\'.

item_prototype.name: NET-SNMP-AGENT-MIB::nsDebugTokenStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: Whether to generate debug output for the corresponding debug token prefix. Nothing will be generated unless both nsDebuggingEnabled is true(1) and this instance is active(1). Note that is valid for an instance to be left with the value notInService(2) indefinitely - i.e. the meaning of \'abnormally long\' (see RFC 2579, RowStatus) for this table is infinite.

discovery_rule.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressTable
discovery_rule.description: This table contains addressing information relevant to the entity\'s interfaces. This table does not contain multicast address information. Tables for such information should be contained in multicast specific MIBs, such as RFC 3019. While this table is writable, the user will note that several objects, such as ipAddressOrigin, are not. The intention in allowing a user to write to this table is to allow them to add or remove any entry that isn\'t permanent. The user should be allowed to modify objects and entries when that would not cause inconsistencies within the table. Allowing write access to objects, such as ipAddressOrigin, could allow a user to insert an entry and then label it incorrectly. Note well: When including IPv6 link-local addresses in this table, the entry must use an InetAddressType of \'ipv6z\' in order to differentiate between the possible interfaces.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressIfIndex[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The index value that uniquely identifies the interface to which this entry is applicable. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is the same interface as identified by the same value of the IF-MIB\'s ifIndex.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The type of address. broadcast(3) is not a valid value for IPv6 addresses (RFC 3513).

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressOrigin[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: * enum, other, 1,

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The status of the address, describing if the address can be used for communication. In the absence of other information, an IPv4 address is always preferred(1).

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressCreated[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was created. If this entry was created prior to the last re- initialization of the local network management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressLastChanged[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was last updated. If this entry was updated prior to the last re- initialization of the local network management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressRowStatus[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The status of this conceptual row. The RowStatus TC requires that this DESCRIPTION clause states under which circumstances other objects in this row can be modified. The value of this object has no effect on whether other objects in this conceptual row can be modified. A conceptual row can not be made active until the ipAddressIfIndex has been set to a valid index.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipAddressStorageType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The storage type for this conceptual row. If this object has a value of \'permanent\', then no other objects are required to be able to be modified.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipNetToPhysicalPhysAddress[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The media-dependent `physical\' address. As the entries in this table are typically not persistent when this object is written the entity SHOULD NOT save the change to non-volatile storage.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipNetToPhysicalLastUpdated[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The value of sysUpTime at the time this entry was last updated. If this entry was updated prior to the last re- initialization of the local network management subsystem, then this object contains a zero value.

item_prototype.name: IP-MIB::ipNetToPhysicalType[{#SNMPINDEX}]
item_prototype.description: The type of mapping. Setting this object to the value invalid(2) has the effect of invalidating the corresponding entry in the ipNetToPhysicalTable. That is, it effectively dis- associates the interface identified with said entry from the mapping identified with said entry. It is an implementation-specific matter as to whether the agent removes an invalidated entry from the table. Accordingly, management stations must be prepared to receive tabular information from agents that corresponds to entries not currently in use. Proper interpretation of such entries requires examination of the relevant ipNetToPhysicalType object. The \'dynamic(3)\' type indicates that the IP address to physical addresses mapping has been dynamically resolved using e.g., IPv4 ARP or the IPv6 Neighbor Discovery protocol.
